member_organisations:
Full Members (Members of Parliament): http://www.eufores.org/index.php?id=32 
 
Supporting Members (Organisations): http://www.eufores.org/index.php?id=149
eu_initiatives: Directives and other legislation on renewable energy, energy efficiency, energy union, climate change, clean energy package
organisation_name: European Forum for Renewable Energy Sources (EUFORES)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit:
EUFORES is a European cross-party network of Members of Parliaments from the European Parliament as well as from the EU28 national and regional Parliaments. EUFORES core objective is the promotion of renewable energy and energy efficiency.  
 
EUFORES is supported by a variety of non-parliamentary members from the renewable energy industry, scientific institutes, energy agencies and NGOs - all strongly committed to renewable energy and energy efficiency. EUFORES has developed a broad spectrum of activities in order to coordinate the exchange between its members.  
 
EUFORES is governed by three Presidents, all prominent Members of the European Parliament. The daily operations and management of EUFORES are carried out by the Secretary-General and the Secretariat in Brussels.
relevant_communication:
Main EUFORES EU projects are: 
- Keep on track (terminated in 2015) 
- Energy Efficiency Watch (terminated in 2017) 
- Renewables Networking Platform (contract with DG ENER) 
EUFORES organises several kinds of events: 
- Big European Inter-Parliamentary Meetings in national parliaments 
- EU Parliament events 
- national parliamentary events
